info.title: Merchent APIs
info.description: SallaSDK offers developers seamless integration and interaction with the Salla platform's APIs, enabling the creation of customized e-commerce solutions with ease and efficiency.

get.description: You can list all customers related to your store directly from this endpoint. Also, it allows you to filter them using a keyword, the endpoint would retrieve any customer matches this keyword in their data whether in their mobile number or email or name.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description:
- `customer.mobile` | 966511804534
- `customer.name` | Del John
- `shipping_number` | Find a specific shipment by its ID from [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/ef30fb0e90b00-list-order-shipments)
- `reference_id` | 613398835
- `tag_name` | Find a specific tag by its name from [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/c301cfb379e20-list-tags)

200.description: Array of Customers and their corresponding informations

post.description:
Customers can be created within your store at Salla by providing the required data in this endpoint. 

You may need the [Countries List](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/b3A6ODUwMzM4-list-countries) endpoint to get the mobile and country codes.

Also, you may use the [Customer Groups list](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/b3A6NTU1NzcwNg-list-customer-groups) to add the group's IDs for the new customer. Kindly note that customer's email and mobile number are unique.

error.message: null

get.description: you can return a specific customer's Details by providing the ID of the customer you want to get his details in the *customer* path parameter.

200.description: Successful query of information of a specific customer

put.description:
Update a customer using this Endpoint. Provide the ID of the customer you want to update in the *customer* path parameter. The response will be all the customer updated data.

>üí° __Note__
>
> The existing value of all skipped parameters will remain unchanged.

put.description:
You can use this endpoint to ban (Add to blacklist) one of your customers by providing the ID of the customer you want to ban in the *customer* path parameter.

Banned customer won't be able to create new orders. 

>üí° __Note__
>
>Banned customers can login to the store.

null

get.description: This endpoint allows you to list all the customer groups in your store. Customer groups are aiming to divide customers into smaller groups instead of the default customers group to be able to serve them better and to determine their needs and also give each group special treatment.

200.description: A successful call returns a payload that contains a current list of the store customers groups

post.description:
This Endpoint allows you to create customer groups by providing the group name which is required and the conditions (similarities between group members) and the features that the group members will have.

**type** may be one of these 
1. total_sales
2. total_orders
3. store_rating
4. doesnt_have_orders
 
and the **symbols** may be one of these
1. '>'
2. '<'
3. 'between'

>üí° __Note__
>
>To add the payment methods you will need to get the payment methods list from [Payment](../~1payment~1methods/get) Endpoint

error.message: null

post.description:
Registering a new webhook is to notify/update/delete an external service when an event has occurred. To trigger your webhook to send data, You can choose one event from the list of events which You can get from the [List Events](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchent/ZG9jOjI0NTE3NDg1-webhook#list-of-events) Endpoint. >üí° __Note__ > > ‚úÖ New subscriptions with the same URL and event updates/restore old webhooks (if exist)
> ‚úÖ Added URL must allow POST requests
> ‚úÖ By default, all new registered webhooks will be set as version `2`. If you want to use version `1` of the webhook, pass that in your request parameter. Read more on Webhooks [here](https://salla.dev/blog/webhooks-101/).

200.description: New webhook has been registered successfully

get.description: This endpoint allows you to list all available, registered, and active webhooks related to the store.

You can list all the available events that can be used in registering webhooks from this endpoint.

Look more into Webhook Events from [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchent/ZG9jOjI0NTE3NDg1-webhook#list-of-events).

200.description: A successful call returns a payload that contains a current list of the available webhooks events.

delete.description:
This endpoint allows you to unsubscribe/deactivate a webhook from the active webhooks list at your store. 

You can define which webhook to delete by using `url` and/or `id` query parameters.

Using `url` will delete all registered webhooks to this URL.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Webhook registered URL. `requiredif` no ID is passed.

get.description:
An abandoned cart occurs when a customer adds an item to their cart and didn't complete the purchase.

Salla helps you by providing a list of abandoned carts that contains all the needed data that you can use to help customers continue the purchasing process.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: returns all the carts created within or before an offset time. EX: `15` minutes

200.description: A successful call returns a payload that contains a current list of abandoned carts details

get.description: This endpoint allows you to list all available taxes for your store.

200.description: A successful call returns a payload that contains a current list of Taxes

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new tax and return the corresponding tax id.

You must add tax rate and specify which country that tax will be applied to by providing a country id.

>Note: you can get country id from [List Countries](../~1countries/get) Endpoint.

get.description: You can list all orders related to your store directly from this endpoint. Also, it allows you to filter them using a different set of optional parameters.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description:
- `customer.mobile` | 966511804534
- `customer.name` | Del John
- `shipping_number` | Find a specific shipment by its ID from [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/ef30fb0e90b00-list-order-shipments)
- `reference_id` | 613398835
- `tag_name` | Find a specific tag by its name from [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/c301cfb379e20-list-tags)

parameters.name: payment_method
parameters.description: Find orders for specific payment method. List of available payment methods can be found [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/a29a42ec19038-available-methods)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Find orders for specific status (array of ID integers). List of statuses can be found [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/a236a8974fa22-list-order-statuses)

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Find orders created after a specific date.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Find orders created before a specific date.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Integer find orders for specific country. List of countries can be found [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/b3A6ODUwMzM4-list-countries)

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Find orders for specific city. List of cities can be found [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/b3A6NTU1Nzc3OA-list-cities)

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: Find orders for specific product via its `name` variable. List of products can be found [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/b3A6MTMzOTUw-list-products)

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Find orders for specific branch (array of integers). List of branches can be found [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/b3A6Njk2Njg5-list-branches)

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Find orders for specific tags (array of ID integers). List of tags can be found here [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/b3A6NTU1Nzc3OQ-list-tags)

parameters.name: expanded
parameters.description: Get full details of orders same as [order details](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/6c0426c1988a8-order-details) response by setting the value to `true`.

parameters.name: reference_id
parameters.description: This is the ID that appears to the store owner

200.description: A successful call returns a payload that contains a current list of store orders

This endpoint allows you to update the status for a specific order by providing the ID of the order in the *order* path parameter.
Also you should pass either the status ID or the slug.

>üí° __Note__
>
> To update an order status, you may use one of the following:
> - `slug` to update an order with predefined Salla statuses.
> - `status_id` to update the Custom Order Sub-status.

You can you can assign specific order with a tag by using the tag name. by providing the ID of the order you want to add this tag to it in the *order.id* path parameter.

You can get a list of available tags from [List Tags](../~1orders~1tags/get) endpoint.

You can get a list of orders assigned to a tag from [List Orders](../~1orders/get) endpoint using tag query parameter.

get.description: This endpoint allows you to fetch a list of order invoices.

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to create an invoice to a specific order from your side, either as an uploaded `file`, path `url`, or ordinary `data` and `order` in your body request.

> üí° __Note__
>
> For the `order` data type, you will need to specify the Invoice issuance to be from Salla. However, for the other data types available, such as `data`, `url`, and `file`, you will need to set it to custom from the [Store Settings](s.salla.sa/settings).

get.description: This endpoint allows you to fetch a list of coupons.

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to create Single Coupon, and Group Coupons.

<!-- theme: warning -->
> üí° __Note__
>
> Although the response payload you will be receiving of the two coupon-types at once, each has its own required Body Requests.

<!--
type: tab
title: Single Coupon
-->

When creating a `Single Coupon`, ensure that you are sending the following required variables:

| Attribute | Type | Is Required |
| -- | -- | -- |
| `code` | string | Yes |
| `type` | string | Yes |
| `amount` | number | Yes |
| `free_shipping` | boolean | Yes |
| `expiry_date` | string | Yes |
| `exclude_sale_products` | boolean | Yes |

If `marketing_active` is valued as `true`, then when creating `Marketing Coupons`, ensure that you are sending the following required variables:

| Attribute | Type | Is Required |
| -- | -- | -- |
| `marketing_active` | boolean | Yes |
| `marketing_name` | string | Yes |
| `marketing_type` | string | Yes |
| `marketing_amount` | number | Yes |




<!--
type: tab
title: Group Coupons
-->

If `is_group` is valued as `true`, then when creating `Group Coupons`, ensure that you are sending the following required variables:

| Attribute | Type | Is Required |
| -- | -- | -- |
| `is_group` | boolean | Yes |
| `group_coupons_count` | number | Yes |
| `group_suffix` | string | Yes |
| `group_name` | string | Yes |
| `type` | string | Yes |
| `amount` | number | Yes |
| `free_shipping` | boolean | Yes |
| `expiry_date` | string | Yes |
| `exclude_sale_products` | boolean | Yes |

If `marketing_active` is valued as `true`, then when creating `Marketing Coupons`, ensure that you are sending the following required variables:

| Attribute | Type | Is Required |
| -- | -- | -- |
| `marketing_active` | boolean | Yes |
| `marketing_name` | string | Yes |
| `marketing_type` | string | Yes |
| `marketing_amount` | number | Yes |


<!-- type: tab-end -->

can_cancel.description:
Check whether or not if the order is allowed to be cancelled by store customers.
`True` value should be set if the order status is in under review and in progress, as according to the store settings.

products.description:
A list of products, that will be shipped. Using the `id`, you can pass an existing product, or you can create a custom product by passing the `name` and `price`.

Available product attributes:

| Variable Name | Type    | Description                                                    |
| ------------- | ------- | -------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `id`          | `integer` | The ID of the product. 'requiredIf' it is an existing product. |
| `name`        | `string`  | The name of the product. 'requiredIf' it is a custom product.  |
| `price`       | `number` | The price of the product. 'requiredIf' it is a custom product. |
| `quantity`    | `integer` | The amount of the product. |

ShipmentsResponse.title: Shipments Response
ShipmentsResponse.description: This schema describes a model for a shipment response, including details about shipments made by a courier service, their associated orders, and shipment properties like ID, type, courier, tracking info, payment method, source, and status, as well as package details like name, SKU, price, quantity, and weight. Other info, such as creation date, currency, and trackability, is also included in the response, returned as **an array of objects** for use in a RESTful API for querying shipment data.

success.description: Whether or not the response was successful

id.description: This field refers to a unique identifier for the shipment.

order_id.description: This field refers to the unique identifier for the order associated with the shipment.

order_reference_id.description: This field refers to a reference ID that can be used to look up additional information about the order

courier_id.description: Shipment Courier ID. Find a complete list of Shipment companies [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/shipping-providers-api/a4c3f0cd7533a-list-shipping-companies)

trackable.description: Whether or not the shipment is trackable

is_international.description: Whether the shipment is shipped internationally

currency.description: Shipment Total Currency. You may refer to the external Merchant API Docs for the List of Currencies from [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/f18b629e987b8-list-currencies)
Shipment Cash On Delivery Currency. You may refer to the external Merchant API Docs for the List of Currencies from [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/f18b629e987b8-list-currencies)
Shipment Packages Price Currency. You may refer to the external Merchant API Docs for the List of Currencies from [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/f18b629e987b8-list-currencies)

shipment_content_type.description: the type of packaging used for a shipment

packaging_type.description: the type of content being shipped

courier_id.description: Shipment Courier ID. Find a complete list of Shipment companies [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/shipping-providers-api/a4c3f0cd7533a-list-shipping-companies)

overwrite_exists_pending.description: Whether or not to allow the pending shipment, which was generated during the order creation, to be replace by the new shipment that is assigned by the Order Management App

currency.description: Shipment Cash On Delivery Currency. You may refer to the external Merchant API Docs of the List of Currencies [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/f18b629e987b8-list-currencies)

country_id.description: Shipment Ship To Country. Find a complete list of countries [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/fb6449dc8871f-list-countries).

city_id.description: Shipment Ship To CityFind a complete list of cities [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/48053498fdba3-list-cities).

currency.description: Shipment Packages Price Currency. You may refer to the external Merchant API Docs of the List of Currencies [here](https://docs.salla.dev/docs/merchant/f18b629e987b8-list-currencies)
